rules_text:
Flying, indestructible
If Zec’tala, the Imprisoned would enter the battlefield and it wasn’t summoned, split it into four pieces instead. [i](To split Zec’tala into four pieces, exile it and shuffle four token cards named Invoke Zec’tala into your library. They’re colorless sorcery cards with mana cost {0} and “Draw a card. Then exile this card and put an invocation counter on a Zec’tala you own in exile. Then if that Zec’tala has four or more invocation counters on it, summon it by putting it onto the battlefield under your control.”)[/i]
notes:
Inspiration — Cosmic Horror, Old Ones, Cthullu, Imprisoned Threat/Deity

Mechanical Uniqueness — Token cards, special playing method, hearthstone-like flavorful wording

**More straightforward wording (though less fun)
Flying, indestructible
If CARDNAME would enter the battlefield and it wasn’t put onto the battlefield with the effect of a card named Invoke LEGENDNAME, instead exile it and shuffle shuffle four token cards named Invoke LEGENDNAME into your library. They’re colorless sorcery cards with mana cost 0, “Draw a card. Exile this card.” and “If you’ve cast at least three other cards this game named Invoke LEGENDNAME, put a card you own in exile named CARDNAME from exile onto the battlefield.”
